intro: Adinandra nigropunctata, commonly known as the black-punctured adinandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with dark, raised dots. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, which are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
